Description: EXCEPTIONAL NEAR MINT CONDITION, GREAT PLAYER! RARE CARDINAL RED FINISH!!! This is an EPIPHONE (by GIBSON) Les Paul Standard electric guitar. Made in 2015. It comes with the hard shell case you see in the pictures. 100% Original and Complete. This guitar is truly show room clean. The back of the neck is perfectly SMOOTH! The frets and finger board look NEW! Looks like it has barely been played. First class guitar, not stamped 'used' or '2nd' like so many here on ebay. Features include... chrome hardware, Grover tuners, 22 fret neck with rosewood fingerboard and pearly block markers, two humbucker pickups, three way PU selector switch, tun-o-matic bridge, stop tailpiece, bound arched top body, single ply pick guard, mahogany body. Professionally set up. Everything works as it should... electronics, truss rod, bridge, tuners, etc. I have serviced the guitar... cleaned and polished the neck and body, cleaned and conditioned the fingerboard, cleaned and polished the frets, installed new strings (ghs Boomers 10-46), adjusted bridge/truss rod/ intonation, etc. She is ready to play and PLAYS GREAT!! Buyer pays $39.95 shipping, insurance, packaging and handling to contiguous 48 states. Items over 2 lbs will ship Fed Ex ground, (no PO Boxes). Thanks for looking and good luck. Please take a look at my other listings and the last picture I have a great collection of inexpensive, but professional grade guitars listed for sale... a Mexican MIM made in Mexico Fender Stratocaster strat in Oly Olympic white with maple neck, a Korean NEAR MINT EPIPHONE LES PAUL STANDARD FLAME TOP TRANS CHERRY LIMITED EDITION electric guitar with gig bag case, a made in Korea Epi Korina Flying V 1958 reissue, a near mint SG G-400 LIMITED EDITION CUSTOM SHOP 1966 REISSUE with original hard shell case, a NEAR MINT EPIPHONE LES PAUL STANDARD in Cardinal Red and an exceptional transparent cherry red Ibanez AS73 TCR-12-01 semi hollow es 335 style electric guitar. Often requiring reassembly, tuning and/or adjusting. -If you receive an item that has been damaged in shipping, CONTACT ME IMMEDIATELY and save all the packaging. We will work through the claim together until things are right. -I can ship almost anywhere, but free shipping or a fixed shipping price is for the contiguous 48 states ONLY. If you have a foreign address, use an APO, live in Alaska, Puerto Rico, etc., message me for a shipping price BEFORE you buy. Due to the cost and risk of shipping I do not accept returns from outside the US. Once the package is delivered to the carrier, the foreign buyer is responsible for the item, including but not limited to taxes, fees, customs issues, delays, damage, lose, duty, etc.
